effects: You always have the Charm Person and Mirror Image spells prepared.
Immediately after you cast an enchantment or illusion spell using a spell slot, you can force a creature you can see within 60 feet to make a Wisdom save against your spell save DC.
On a failed save, the creature is charmed or frightened (your choice) for 1 minute; it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
You can restore your use of this feature by expending one use of Bardic Inspiration (no action required).
limits: Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
notes: saving throw DC formula noted in effects

effects: You can expend one use of Bardic Inspiration and roll the die.
Choose up to a number of other creatures within 60 feet equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1); each gains temporary hit points equal to twice the number rolled.
Each chosen creature can use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
You always have the Command spell prepared.
You cast Command without expending a spell slot and take on an unearthly appearance for 1 minute or until your concentration ends.
During this time, you can cast Command as a bonus action without expending a spell slot.
Any creature charmed by you automatically fails its saving throw against Command cast with this feature.
You can restore your use of this feature by expending a level 3+ spell slot (no action required).
limits: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

effects: You assume a magically majestic presence for 1 minute or until you have the Incapacitated condition.
For the duration, the first time each turn a creature hits you with an attack roll, it must succeed on a Charisma save against your spell save DC or the attack misses.
limits: Once you assume this presence, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
notes: saving throw DC formula noted in effects
